page.title: 08North Wood,Dartington
page.content: We visited this wood to look at the many varieties of conifers that have been planted here,including some giant redwoods over 40m high .However we found the iron age earthworks, which was excavated by archeologists in 1965 .They found 3 enclosures inside which were the wooden huts of a village.The ditches and banks are still easily seen.The construction was made by Britons about 200 to 400AD and the fertile soil would have yielded good crops .With no trees then they would have had a splendid view down the River Dart for greater security.This site was lived in both before and after the Roman invasion and this makes it a most unusual monument.
